column2: 1.01 - Supply of proprietary tack coat for use in asphalt placement works.
Frequency: Prior to the commencement of asphalt placement works.
Acceptance Criteria: Submission of the properties, specifications and test requirements for proprietary tack coats.
1.02 - Supply of asphalt to a nominated mix design.
Frequency: Not less than twenty (20) working days prior to the scheduled commencement of asphalt production.
Acceptance Criteria: Submission of the proposed mix design for each nominal size asphalt mix including results of the mix design tests.
Record of conformity: NATA accredited test certificates, mix design report
Frequency: Prior to the commencement of asphalt placement works.
Acceptance Criteria: Mobile straight edge equipment to be used in the asphalt laying works has been calibrated.
• Not less than five (5) days prior to the scheduled commencement of asphalt paving works.
• Prior notice (minimum 48 hours) of commencement of trial to be given to Contract Administrator.

• All resources required for a trial of minimum tonnage 40 t of each nominal mix size, placed in a minimum of two paving runs, with a joint suitable for testing, are available and all arrangements for the trial have been made.
2.02 - Extraction of cores from construction trial sections.
• At the completion of each construction trial, after the asphalt has cooled to ambient temperature and not more than 24 hours after construction.
• A minimum of six (6) cores are cut from within lanes, and six (6) cores are cut over a joint.
• Cores are not less than 100 mm diameter and are cut from the finished asphalt construction trial section.
2.03 - Repair of core holes in construction trial sections.
Frequency: At the completion of core extraction.
• All debris, slurry and water has been removed from the core hole and the core walls and floor are completely dry prior to reinstatement.

• Tack coat has been applied to the walls and floor of core hole, and the hole reinstated with hot mix asphalt approved for use in this project and placed and compacted in lifts not more than 50 mm compacted thickness.
• The filled hole is flush to the surrounding pavement surface.
2.04 - Layer thickness of construction trial section.
Frequency: At the completion of each construction trial and prior to the commencement of full scale production and placement of asphalt.
• The average compacted layer thickness of a minimum of 4 cores is within the accepted range of:
– Minimum of 40 mm and maximum of 85 mm for 14mm NMS asphalt, or
– Minimum of 75 mm and maximum of 110 mm for 20mm NMS asphalt.
Record of conformity: NATA accredited test certificates
Frequency: Within 24 hours after the completion of each construction trial.
• Characteristic value of air voids are within the range of:
– Surfacing layers: 3.0-6.5% inclusive for mat and 3.0-8.0% inclusive for joints, or
Record of conformity: NATA accredited test certificates
2.06 - Finished surface levels of construction trial sections.
• At the completion of each construction trial and prior to the commencement of full scale production and placement of asphalt.
• All finished surface levels have been surveyed to an accuracy of 2 mm with readings to 1 mm by a licensed surveyor.
Record of conformity: Record of finished surface levels
2.07 - Surface smoothness of construction trial sections.
• At the completion of each construction trial and prior to the commencement of full scale production and placement of asphalt.

• Surface smoothness has been tested in each placing lane in longitudinal direction parallel to the centreline, and in the transverse direction at intervals not exceeding 10 m using a mobile straight edge operated at a speed not exceeding 5km/hr.
• The finished surface complies with Item 3.14 of this ITP.
Record of conformity: Record of location and extent of any surface irregularities
• At the completion of each construction trial and prior to the commencement of full scale production and placement of asphalt.

• Submission of all test results and written advice to Contract Administrator regarding any alterations in procedures or adjustments to plant and equipment as necessary to produce asphalt in accordance with specified requirements.
2.09 - Selection of reference area for surface finish.
Frequency: After the completion of construction trials.
Acceptance Criteria: Agreement with Contract Administrator of reference area/s for each nominal size mix and photographs of each reference area.
Record of conformity: Photographs of reference areas
2.10 - Supply of asphalt as per job mix.
• After the completion of construction trials and not less than two (2) working days prior to the planned commencement of full scale asphalt works.
• Submission of the complete details of the job mix, job aggregate particle size distribution, job bitumen content, and job mix temperature for each nominal mix size.
Record of conformity: Job mix report
Frequency: Prior to the commencement of a shift.
• Ramps are planned for all discontinuities greater than 25 mm in height.
• The maximum gradient is between 0.5% and 1.0% for discontinuities ≤50 mm in height, and ≤0.5% for discontinuities >50 mm in height.
• The distance between successive transverse ramps is not less than 60 m.
• Planned ramps on taxiways are no shorter than 4 m and have slope not exceeding 1.5% relative to the current slope.
Record of conformity: Temperary ramp design
• Prior to the commencement of asphalt placement works in each work period.
• All paving plant, tools and equipment, including standby plant and equipment, are in working condition and are free from leaks of oil, water, hydraulic fluid and fuel.
• Tyres and tracks of all equipment are clean and any build-up of bitumen or other material has been removed.
Record of conformity: Daily plant inspection verification checklist
• Prior to the commencement of asphalt placement works in each work period.
• Surface to be paved is essentially dry and free from surface water.
• It is not raining and no rain is imminent.
• The surface temperature is at or above the minimum specified in Note 1.
• If the surface temperature is <15oC, the layer thickness is <30 mm or the winde speed is >20 knots, the cold weather paving plan has been implemented.
Frequency: Immediately before applying tack coat.
• All loose and foreign materials have been removed from the surface to be paved to a distance of approximately 300 mm beyond the edge of the area.
• Any areas of oil or fuel spillage have been cleaned with detergent and flushed with clean water.
Frequency: Prior to the commencement of asphalt placement in each work period.
• A uniform cover of tack coat has been applied to all existing surfaces on or against which asphalt is to be placed, unless the surface is freshly placed asphalt not greater than 3 days old.
• Any vertical faces and edges have received 2 full applications.
• The residual bitumen is within the range 0.15-0.25 L/m2 and at least 80% of the surface has turned from brown to black.
• Any pooled tack coat has been brushed out prior to breaking.
Frequency: Prior to the commencement of asphalt placement in each work period.
• All necessary surface preparation and treatments within the paving lane and adjacent paving lane have been completed and inspected by Contract Administrator.
• Cold joints are kept to a minimum. All joints are smooth, true, dense, free from segregation and have the same texture and smoothness as elsewhere on the finished surface.
Frequency: Each load of asphalt delivered to site.
• Asphalt temperature is ≥165°C for PMB or  ≥150°C for residual C320 at point of delivery to paver.
• Load does not contain cold unworkabout material, is not contaminated with foreign material and has not been wetted by rain.
• During asphalt placement works at intervals not exceeding 10 m (except at the commencement of transverse joints where the interval must be not less than 5 m).
• Thickness of asphalt layer conforms to asphalt thickness on drawings or specifications.
Inspection/ Test Method: Dipstick and ruler
3.10 - Compaction with vibratory steel wheel roller.
• The temperature of the asphalt mat is ≥125°C for PMB or ≥95°C for residual C320 at the commencement of rolling with steel drum roller.
• Rolling is conducted as per defined rolled rolling pattern.
• The number of roller passes applied to each paving run has been recorded.
Record of conformity: Shift report, ITP
• Six (6) roller passes are completed prior to the temperature of the asphalt mat falling below 115°C for PMB or 70°C for residual C320.
• As soon as possible after the completion of asphalt placement works in each work period and prior to the next work period following completion of the course.
• The average thickness of a nominal thickness layer is not more than 10% above or 6% below that specified, and has no part less than 85% of the specified thickness.
• The thickness of a variable thickness course complies with the specified finished surface levels.
• The average compacted layer thickness of a minimum of 4 cores is within the accepted range of:
– Minimum of 40 mm and maximum of 85 mm for 14mm NMS asphalt, or
– Minimum of 75 mm and maximum of 110 mm for 20mm NMS asphalt.
Record of conformity: NATA accredited test certificate
• As soon as possible after the completion of asphalt placement works in each work period and prior to the next work period following completion of the course.
• Record of finished surface levels to be submitted to Contract Administrator within one (1) working day of the completion of the level survey.
• The finished surface coincides with the surface of abutting pavements, except where rolled over edges are specified.
• The finished surface level is not more than 7 mm above and 5 mm below the design finished surface levels shown on the Drawings.
• The absolute difference between the design surface level and the final surface level between two adjacent survey points in the longitudinal direction is not be more than 7 mm.
• A compliance rate of 97.5% of all the survey points has been achieved and no deviation in excess of 10 mm has been measured.
Inspection/ Test Method: Inspection and survey
Record of conformity: Record of finished surface levels
Frequency: After completion of compaction of asphalt with a pneumatic tyred roller and prior to back rolling.

• The finished surface of all asphalt surfacing courses does not deviate from the testing edge of an approved 3.5 m straight edge by more than 3 mm (longitudinally) and 5 mm (transversely) on aircraft pavements, and 5 mm (longitudinally) and 7 mm (transversely) on shoulders.
Record of conformity: Record of location and extent of any surface irregularities
Frequency: As soon as possible after the completion of asphalt placement works.
• The finished surface is free from roller marks, vertical discontinuities, dragged areas, cracks, segregation, open textured patches and has a tightly bonded closed surface of uniform appearance.
Record of conformity: Shift report, ITP
Frequency: Not less than 60 minutes prior to the scheduled time for opening pavements to aircraft operations.
Acceptance Criteria: Pavement surfaces are completely free of all loose material.
• At the completion of asphalt placement works, after the asphalt has cooled to ambient temperature throughout and not more than 24 hours after the lot was constructed.

• From each lot of aircraft pavement, cores are cut at a rate of not less than one core per 500 m2 or a minimum of 6 cores within lanes (whichever yields the greater number of cores) and not less than one core every 150 m of joint, or a minimum of 4 cores on joints (whichever yields the greater number of cores).
• Cores are not less than 100 mm diameter and are cut from the finished lot after the asphalt has cooled to ambient temperature and not more than 24 hours after construction.
Frequency: At the completion of core extraction.
• All debris, slurry and water has been removed from the core hole and the core walls and floor are completely dry prior to reinstatement.

• Tack coat has been applied to the walls and floor of core hole, and the hole reinstated with hot mix asphalt approved for use in this project and placed and compacted in lifts not more than 50 mm compacted thickness.
• The filled hole is flush to the surrounding pavement surface.
Frequency: Within 24 hours after the construction of the lot.
• Characteristic value of air voids are within the range of:
– Surfacing layers: 3.0-6.5% inclusive for mat and 3.0-8.0% inclusive for joints, or
Inspection/ Test Method: AS 2891.14.2 (mat locations) or AS 2891.9.2 (joint locations)
Record of conformity: NATA accredited test certificates
Note 1: Table 5115-1 Minimum Surface Temperature for Asphalt Placement
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
